com.googlecode.jau
Class JAU

java.lang.Object
  com.googlecode.jau.JAU

public class JAU
extends Object

Annotation based implementation of common methods.

Method Detail

registerCopier

public static <T> void registerCopier(Class<T> c,
                                      Copier<T> copier)
Registers a user defined Copier for a class. A copier cannot be registered for an array or a primitive type.

Parameters:
c - a class
copier - a copier for the class

registerStringifier

public static <T> void registerStringifier(Class<T> c,
                                           Stringifier<T> stringifier)
Registers a user defined Stringifier for a class. An implementation for computing string representation cannot be registered for an array, an enum or a primitive type.

Parameters:
c - a class
stringifier - an implementation for computing string representation

copier - a copier for the class

                                         HashCoder<T> hc)
Registers a user defined hash code algorithm for a class. A coder cannot be registered for an array or a primitive type.

Parameters:
c - a class
hc - a hash code algorithm for the class

hashCode

public static int hashCode(Object a)
Generates hash code for an object Object.hashCode(). Classes should be annotated using JAUHashCode (directly or through the corresponding package) for automatic computation of hash code via reflection. Another way is to register a user defined object to compute hash codes via registerHashCoder(java.lang.Class, com.googlecode.jau.HashCoder). Static and synthetic fields will be ignored. Default HashCoders are registered for the following classes:
  • StringBuffer
  • StringBuilder

Parameters:
a - object or null
Returns:
generated hash code. If same fields in a class are marked with JAUEquals and JAUHashCode, the value returned by this function and by equals(java.lang.Object, java.lang.Object) are consistent.

hashCode

public static int hashCode(Object a,
                           int initialNonZeroOddNumber,
                           int multiplierNonZeroOddNumber)
Generates hash code for an object Object.hashCode(). Classes should be annotated using JAUHashCode (directly or through the corresponding package) for automatic computation of hash code via reflection. Another way is to register a user defined object to compute hash codes via registerHashCoder(java.lang.Class, com.googlecode.jau.HashCoder). Static and synthetic fields will be ignored. Default HashCoders are registered for the following classes:
  • StringBuffer
  • StringBuilder

Parameters:
a - an object or null
initialNonZeroOddNumber - a non-zero, odd number used as the initial value
multiplierNonZeroOddNumber - a non-zero, odd number used as the multiplier
Returns:
generated hash code. If same fields in a class are marked with JAUEquals and JAUHashCode, the value returned by this function and by equals(java.lang.Object, java.lang.Object) are consistent.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if initialNonZeroOddNumber is 0 or even or multiplierNonZeroOddNumber is 0 or even

equals

public static boolean equals(Object a,
                             Object b)
Compares 2 objects Object.equals(java.lang.Object). Classes should be annotated using @JAUEquals (directly or through the corresponding package) to be compared using reflection. Another way is to register a user defined object to copy values via registerComparator(java.lang.Class, java.util.Comparator) At last .equals(Object) is called. Static and synthetic fields will be ignored.

Parameters:
a - first object or null
b - second object or null
Returns:

true, if (a == null) && (b == null)

false, if (a == null) && (b != null)

false, if (a != null) && (b == null)

true, if (a == b)

false, if (a.getClass() != b.getClass())

arrays are compared deeply using this method for each element for classes annotated with JAUEquals

If a class is not annotated, but implements java.util.Map, it is compared so JAU.equals() is called for each value instead of a.equals(b)

a.equals(b) otherwise

copy

public static void copy(Object a,
                        Object b)
Copies all data from one object to another (deep copy) Classes should be annotated using JAUCopy (directly or through the corresponding package) to be compared using reflection. Another way is to register a user defined object to copy values via registerCopier(java.lang.Class, com.googlecode.jau.Copier) Static and synthetic fields will be ignored. Default Copiers are registered for the following classes:
  • java.lang.StringBuffer
  • java.lang.StringBuilder

Parameters:
a - first object
b - second object
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if

a or b are instances of different classes

class of a and b is immutable isImmutableClass(java.lang.Class) i

a or b is null or

a and b are arrays with different lenghts

class of a and b is not annotated with JAUCopy

clone

public static Object clone(Object a)
Firstly, this method creates an object: either by - invoking clone if the class of a implements Cloneable - invoking the default constructor (even if it is private) - invoking the copy constructor if it exists (in this case there will be no special field copying) Copies of the following classes are not created for enumerations or immutable classes isImmutableClass(java.lang.Class)

Parameters:
a - an object or null
Returns:
null, if a == null copy of a otherwise

compare

public static int compare(Object a,
                          Object b)
                   throws IllegalArgumentException
Compares 2 objects. Classes should be annotated using JAUCompareTo (directly or through the corresponding package) to be compared using reflection. Another way is to register a user defined object to copy values via registerComparator(java.lang.Class, java.util.Comparator). Otherwise if a class implements Comparable it's compareTo method is used. Fields in a class are compared from to top bottom (e.g. first field is more important for comparison than the second one). Fields from superclass are more important and will be compared first. Static and synthetic fields will be ignored.

Parameters:
a - first object or null
b - second object or null
Returns:
< 0, if a < b > 0, if a > b 0, if a = b Special cases: 0, if (a == null) && (b == null) -1, if (a == null) && (b != null) 1, if (a != null) && (b == null) 0, if (a == b) arrays are compared deeply using this method for each element for classes annotated with JAUCompareTo only fields annotated with JAUCompareTo will be taken into account and compared a.compareTo(b) otherwise
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if a.getClass() != b.getClass() or the class is not annotated and does not implement Comparable

toString

public static String toString(Object a)
Generates string representation of an object (Object.toString()). Classes should be annotated using JAUToString (directly or through the corresponding package) for automatic computation of string representation via reflection. Static and synthetic fields will be ignored. Enums are represented as "com.example.EnumClass.VALUE"

Parameters:
a - object or null
Returns:
string representation.

toMap

public static Map<String,Object> toMap(Object a)
Creates a map filled with properties from an object. Classes should be annotated using JAUToMap (directly or through the corresponding package) for this to work. Static and synthetic fields will be ignored.

Parameters:
a - object or null
Returns:
a map filled with the property values from a. An empty map is returned if a is null. Otherwise there will be an entry for every property from a with the value from the object. The returned map is mutable.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if a is an enumeration value or an array or the class of a is not annotated with JAUToMap

fromMap

public static void fromMap(Map<String,Object> map,
                           Object a)
Fills an object with properties stored in a map. Classes should be annotated using JAUToMap (directly or through the corresponding package) for this to work. Static and synthetic fields will be ignored.

Parameters:
a - object or null
map - a map filled with the property values, which will be stored in a. Nothing is done if a is null or the class of a is not annotated or an array. Otherwise properties stored in a.
